sub_title: Also visiting Professor at University of Seville since 2019
summary:
Objectives: To contribute to the development and implementation of effective interventions aimed at a healthy lifestyle for healthy people and patients using evidence based theories and methods.
Myself: others may provide you a more objective desription :)

projects.title: Optimizing Patient Care for Complex Type 2 Diabetes Patients: The CT2D Healthy Living  eCoach
projects.description:
Most  interventions  on  improving  diabetes care  focus  on  diabetic  patients  in primary  care,  usually without complex comorbidities. In this project we will focus on the more complex type 2 diabetes (CT2D)  patients  that  are  treated  by  specialized  health  care  professionals  (HCP’s)  in  the  GP  and hospital  setting  as  these  type  of  patients  require  more  guidance  and  more  tailoring  of  their treatment. Study 1 aims to assess among CT2D patients and HCP’s how eHealth can be of added value in the process  of  current  (secondary)  care.  The  input  from  Study  1  will  be  used  to  optimize  program development of the T2D Healthy Living eCoach. Study 2 is a RCT to test the efficacy of the eCoach in comparison with usual care, in an outpatient clinic  and  GP  setting.  The  new  program  will  be  developed  in  conjunction  with  CT2D  patients  and 
HCP’s.  The  RCT  has  two  conditions:  the  new  eCoach  and  standard  care,  with  measurements  at baseline, and at follow-ups at 6 and 12 months after the baseline, and a control condition receiving usual care. The primary outcomes are 1. Diabetes lifestyle score and 2. Medication adherence.  Study 3 assesses the cost effectiveness of the T2D Healthy Living eCoach, from a societal perspective at two levels, the care giver level and the patient level.  
Study  4  determines  facilitating  and  hindering  factors  long  term  implementation  of  the  new  the eCoach  in  in  the  Maastricht  and  other  regions,  as  implementation  is  crucial  for  obtaining  health impact.

projects.title: A Web-based Computer-Tailored Program to Prevent HIV Transmission among University Students in Khartoum State, Sudan
projects.description: The main objective of this project is to evaluate and study the efficacy of a web-based computer-tailored behavioural change. program to reduce HIV transmissions among University students in Khartoum state (Sudan)

projects.title: Influence of publicly available online information on tobacco additives on smoking behavior in the Netherlands
projects.description:
Since 2012, the government in the Netherlands makes information about tobacco additives online available for the general population (www.tabakinfo.nl). So far, little is known about the perceptions and state of knowledge with regard to tobacco additives and whether this information is understood differently by (non-)smokers and people with different educational levels and how they use such a website. 
In 2014 participants were asked to fill out an online questionnaire about TA. Participants randomly allocated to one of the two experimental groups were invited to visit the website which provides information about TA. Follow-up measurement took place after three months for both experimental groups and the control group that was not invited to visit the website.

profile_positions.description:
Teach courses and supervise research. 
Much research is about the effectiveness of health communication interventions
profile_positions.title: Professor in Health Communication

profile_positions.description: I develop and evaluate health communication research projects - and also participate in similar projects initiated by others) aimed at heallth promotion of healthy people and patients, regarding a variety of topics (smoking, alcohol, physcal activity, nutrition, asthma/copd, diabetes, HIV etc.) using an integration of (mostly) social cognition models, an integration also known as the I-Change Model (the Integrated Change Model). Furthermore, part of this endeavor also implies theory development and testing. Several methods are tested, such as school based health promotion, health counseling, and most of all, tailored eHealth interventions.
profile_positions.title: Professor in Health Communication
